data.name: Sparse  Ruler
data.description:
Your job is to create a minimal complete sparse ruler of length n.


A sparse ruler is a ruler in which some of the distance marks may be missing.


A complete sparse ruler allows you to measure any integer distance up to its full length by using the ruler once only. i.e the difference between two of its markings.


A minimal sparse ruler is one in which if one less maring was used, we would not be able to measure all of the distances 1 to n.


You will be required to return a ruler in string format with 1 indicating mark present and 0 indicating mark missing for marks 0 to n.

For example when n=9 the below ruler suffices.

 0123456789

'1110001001'


0-1 measures 1, 0-2 measures 2, 6-9 measures 3, 2-6 measures 4, 1-6 measures 5, 0-6 measures 6, 2-9 measures 7, 1-9 measures 8 and 0-9 measures 9 respectively.




Examples of failing rulers:

n=9, '1110001101', not minimal: can be done with 5 marks as seen above.

n=9, '1110000101', not complete: can't measure a distance of 3.


Note: n will always be a positive number and test cases will allow for different rulers that meet all conditions.



```javascript
perfectruler(3) //could return '1101' or '1011'
perfectruler(8) //could return '111001001'...
```

Good luck!
